DataElement.preferredDefinition: An individual's weight to height ratio according to a study protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An individual's weight to height ratio.

Property.preferredDefinition: One of the anthropometric measures of body mass; it has the highest correlation with skinfold thickness or body density.

Concepts.definition: An individual's weight in kilograms divided by the square of the height in meters.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Study Protocol Patient Body Mass Index Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A subdivision of a person's body mass index (BMI) according to a study protocol.

PermissibleValues.value: BMI greater than or equal to 30
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Greater Than or Equal To Thirty Body Mass Index

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Greater Than or Equal To Thirty Body Mass Index
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.: A natural number greater than twenty-nine and less than thirty-one and the quantity that it denotes.: One of the anthropometric measures of body mass; it has the highest correlation with skinfold thickness or body density.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.
A natural number greater than twenty-nine and less than thirty-one and the quantity that it denotes.
An individual's weight in kilograms divided by the square of the height in meters.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Less Than Thirty Body Mass Index

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Less Than Thirty Body Mass Index
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status.: A natural number greater than twenty-nine and less than thirty-one and the quantity that it denotes.: One of the anthropometric measures of body mass; it has the highest correlation with skinfold thickness or body density.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status.
A natural number greater than twenty-nine and less than thirty-one and the quantity that it denotes.
An individual's weight in kilograms divided by the square of the height in meters.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Less Than Twenty Five Kilogram Per Square Meter

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Less Than Twenty Five Kilogram Per Square Meter
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status.: A natural number greater than twenty-four and less than twenty-six and the quantity that it denotes.: The SI derived unit of spread rate of a substance by mass, used also as a measure of area density and as a dose calculation unit.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status.
A natural number greater than twenty-four and less than twenty-six and the quantity that it denotes.
The SI derived unit of spread rate of a substance by mass, used also as a measure of area density and as a dose calculation unit.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Greater Than or Equal To Twenty Five Kilogram Per Square Meter

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Greater Than or Equal To Twenty Five Kilogram Per Square Meter
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.: A natural number greater than twenty-four and less than twenty-six and the quantity that it denotes.: The SI derived unit of spread rate of a substance by mass, used also as a measure of area density and as a dose calculation unit.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.
A natural number greater than twenty-four and less than twenty-six and the quantity that it denotes.
The SI derived unit of spread rate of a substance by mass, used also as a measure of area density and as a dose calculation unit.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
